intro: Atropis jenisseiensis, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the cold regions of Siberia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is adapted to harsh climates and is often found in tundra and forest-steppe ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
